In (b)𝑏(b)( italic_b ), we expand the norm and use Assumption 4 to state that the expectation on the cross-coupled terms are all zero. We then use 𝔼⁢[∥wk−1∥2]=(σqk−1)2𝔼delimited-[]superscriptdelimited-∥∥superscript𝑤𝑘12superscriptsuperscriptsubscript𝜎𝑞𝑘12\mathbb{E}[\lVert w^{k-1}\rVert^{2}]=(\sigma_{q}^{k-1})^{2}blackboard_E [ ∥ italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] = ( italic_σ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and 𝔼⁢[∥vk∥2]=(σrk)2𝔼delimited-[]superscriptdelimited-∥∥superscript𝑣𝑘2superscriptsuperscriptsubscript𝜎𝑟𝑘2\mathbb{E}[\lVert v^{k}\rVert^{2}]=(\sigma_{r}^{k})^{2}blackboard_E [ ∥ italic_v start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] = ( italic_σ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. Further, Lemma 2 allows us to state that 𝔼⁢[∥Δ⁢exk+1,τi+1∥2]≤2⁢ϵx2𝔼delimited-[]superscriptdelimited-∥∥Δsuperscriptsubscript𝑒𝑥𝑘1subscript𝜏𝑖122superscriptsubscriptitalic-ϵ𝑥2\mathbb{E}[\lVert\Delta e_{x}^{k+1,\tau_{i}+1}\rVert^{2}]\leq 2\epsilon_{x}^{2}blackboard_E [ ∥ roman_Δ italic_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k + 1 , italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] ≤ 2 italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. Considering a trigger at time k𝑘kitalic_k, we have:

𝔼⁢[∥eτi+1∥2]≤𝔼delimited-[]superscriptdelimited-∥∥superscript𝑒subscript𝜏𝑖12absent\displaystyle\mathbb{E}[\lVert e^{\tau_{i+1}}\rVert^{2}]\leqblackboard_E [ ∥ italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] ≤ ∥In2−Kτi+1−1⁢Δ⁢p~τi+1,τi∥2⁢𝔼⁢[∥eτi∥2]+limit-fromsuperscriptdelimited-∥∥subscript𝐼superscript𝑛2superscript𝐾subscript𝜏𝑖11Δsuperscript~𝑝subscript𝜏𝑖1subscript𝜏𝑖2𝔼delimited-[]superscriptdelimited-∥∥superscript𝑒subscript𝜏𝑖2\displaystyle\lVert I_{n^{2}}-K^{\tau_{i+1}-1}\Delta\tilde{p}^{\tau_{i+1},\tau% _{i}}\rVert^{2}\mathbb{E}[\lVert e^{\tau_{i}}\rVert^{2}]+∥ italic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_Δ over~ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT blackboard_E [ ∥ italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] +
(T−1)⁢σ¯q2+∥Kτi+1−1∥2⁢(σ¯r2+2⁢ϵx2),𝑇1superscriptsubscript¯𝜎𝑞2superscriptdelimited-∥∥superscript𝐾subscript𝜏𝑖112superscriptsubscript¯𝜎𝑟22superscriptsubscriptitalic-ϵ𝑥2\displaystyle(T-1)\overline{\sigma}_{q}^{2}+\lVert K^{\tau_{i+1}-1}\rVert^{2}% \big{(}\overline{\sigma}_{r}^{2}+2\epsilon_{x}^{2}\big{)},( italic_T - 1 ) over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + ∥ italic_K start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + 2 italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) , (29)

where σ¯q2=supt∈ℕ0⁢(σqt)2superscriptsubscript¯𝜎𝑞2𝑡subscriptℕ0supsuperscriptsuperscriptsubscript𝜎𝑞𝑡2\overline{\sigma}_{q}^{2}=\underset{t\in\mathbb{N}_{0}}{\mathrm{sup}}({\sigma}% _{q}^{t})^{2}over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = start_UNDERACCENT italic_t ∈ blackboard_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG roman_sup end_ARG ( italic_σ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and σ¯r2=supt∈ℕ0⁢(σrt)2superscriptsubscript¯𝜎𝑟2𝑡subscriptℕ0supsuperscriptsuperscriptsubscript𝜎𝑟𝑡2\overline{\sigma}_{r}^{2}=\underset{t\in\mathbb{N}_{0}}{\mathrm{sup}}({\sigma}% _{r}^{t})^{2}over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = start_UNDERACCENT italic_t ∈ blackboard_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG roman_sup end_ARG ( italic_σ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT with σq,σrsubscript𝜎𝑞subscript𝜎𝑟\sigma_{q},\sigma_{r}italic_σ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_σ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT estimated using (21) and (22), respectively. Tracing back (5.6) recursively to k=0𝑘0k=0italic_k = 0, we obtain the following relation:

𝔼⁢[∥eτi+1∥2]≤𝔼delimited-[]superscriptdelimited-∥∥superscript𝑒subscript𝜏𝑖12absent\displaystyle\mathbb{E}[\lVert e^{\tau_{i+1}}\rVert^{2}]\leqblackboard_E [ ∥ italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] ≤ (c1⁢ξc2⁢T)2⁢|𝒯|⁢𝔼⁢[∥e0∥2]+limit-fromsuperscriptsubscript𝑐1superscript𝜉subscript𝑐2𝑇2𝒯𝔼delimited-[]superscriptdelimited-∥∥superscript𝑒02\displaystyle(c_{1}\xi^{c_{2}T})^{2|\mathcal{T}|}\mathbb{E}[\lVert e^{0}\rVert% ^{2}]+( italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ξ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 | caligraphic_T | end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT blackboard_E [ ∥ italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] +
1−(c1⁢ξc2⁢T)2⁢|𝒯|1−c1⁢ξc2⁢T⁢[(T−1)⁢σ¯q2+Km2⁢(σ¯r2+2⁢ϵx2)],1superscriptsubscript𝑐1superscript𝜉subscript𝑐2𝑇2𝒯1subscript𝑐1superscript𝜉subscript𝑐2𝑇delimited-[]𝑇1superscriptsubscript¯𝜎𝑞2superscriptsubscript𝐾𝑚2superscriptsubscript¯𝜎𝑟22superscriptsubscriptitalic-ϵ𝑥2\displaystyle\frac{1-(c_{1}\xi^{c_{2}T})^{2|\mathcal{T}|}}{1-c_{1}\xi^{c_{2}T}% }\big{[}(T-1)\overline{\sigma}_{q}^{2}+K_{m}^{2}\big{(}\overline{\sigma}_{r}^{% 2}+2\epsilon_{x}^{2}\big{)}\big{]},divide start_ARG 1 - ( italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ξ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 | caligraphic_T | end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ξ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG [ ( italic_T - 1 ) over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + 2 italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ] ,

We now have the following asymptotic result on the variance:

lim|𝒯|→∞𝔼⁢[∥eτi∥2]≤11−c1⁢ξc2⁢T⁢[(T−1)⁢σ¯q2+Km2⁢(σ¯r2+2⁢ϵx2)],subscript→𝒯𝔼delimited-[]superscriptdelimited-∥∥superscript𝑒subscript𝜏𝑖211subscript𝑐1superscript𝜉subscript𝑐2𝑇delimited-[]𝑇1superscriptsubscript¯𝜎𝑞2superscriptsubscript𝐾𝑚2superscriptsubscript¯𝜎𝑟22superscriptsubscriptitalic-ϵ𝑥2\lim_{|\mathcal{T}|\to\infty}\mathbb{E}[\lVert e^{\tau_{i}}\rVert^{2}]\leq% \frac{1}{1-c_{1}\xi^{c_{2}T}}\big{[}(T-1)\overline{\sigma}_{q}^{2}+K_{m}^{2}% \big{(}\overline{\sigma}_{r}^{2}+2\epsilon_{x}^{2}\big{)}\big{]},roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_T | → ∞ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_E [ ∥ italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_τ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] ≤ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ξ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG [ ( italic_T - 1 ) over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( over¯ start_ARG italic_σ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + 2 italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ] ,

5.7 Proof of Theorem 3.10

Before describing the proof, we state the following supporting lemma and remark.

Lemma 5.14 (Projections with smooth functions [49]).

Let y=Π[−1,1]n⁢[x−η⁢u]𝑦subscriptΠsuperscript11𝑛delimited-[]𝑥𝜂𝑢y=\Pi_{[-1,1]^{n}}[x-\eta u]italic_y = roman_Π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ - 1 , 1 ] start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_x - italic_η italic_u ] with y,x,u∈ℝn𝑦𝑥𝑢superscriptℝ𝑛y,x,u\in\mathbb{R}^{n}italic_y , italic_x , italic_u ∈ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. Then, the following inequality holds:

φ⁢(y)≤𝜑𝑦absent\displaystyle\varphi(y)\leqitalic_φ ( italic_y ) ≤ φ⁢(z)+⟨y−z,Φ⁢(x)−u⟩+[L′2−12⁢η]⁢∥y−x∥2+𝜑𝑧𝑦𝑧Φ𝑥𝑢limit-fromdelimited-[]superscript𝐿′212𝜂superscriptdelimited-∥∥𝑦𝑥2\displaystyle\varphi(z)+\langle y-z,\Phi(x)-u\rangle+\Big{[}\frac{L^{\prime}}{% 2}-\frac{1}{2\eta}\Big{]}\lVert y-x\rVert^{2}+italic_φ ( italic_z ) + ⟨ italic_y - italic_z , roman_Φ ( italic_x ) - italic_u ⟩ + [ divide start_ARG italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_η end_ARG ] ∥ italic_y - italic_x ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT +
[L′2+12⁢η]⁢∥z−x∥2−12⁢η⁢∥y−z∥2,∀z∈ℝndelimited-[]superscript𝐿′212𝜂superscriptdelimited-∥∥𝑧𝑥212𝜂superscriptdelimited-∥∥𝑦𝑧2for-all𝑧superscriptℝ𝑛\displaystyle\Big{[}\frac{L^{\prime}}{2}+\frac{1}{2\eta}\Big{]}\lVert z-x% \rVert^{2}-\frac{1}{2\eta}\lVert y-z\rVert^{2},\quad\forall z\in\mathbb{R}^{n}[ divide start_ARG italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG + divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_η end_ARG ] ∥ italic_z - italic_x ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_η end_ARG ∥ italic_y - italic_z ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , ∀ italic_z ∈ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT

where φ𝜑\varphiitalic_φ is the cost function to be minimized and ΦΦ\Phiroman_Φ its gradient. Further, L′superscript𝐿′L^{\prime}italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and η𝜂\etaitalic_η are the smoothness factor of φ𝜑\varphiitalic_φ and the step-size of the gradient descent algorithm, respectively.

Proof 5.15.

The proof is given in [49, Lemma 2].

Remark 5.16 (Composite gradient lipschitzness).

We observe that the Lipschitz and smoothness constant for φpol⁢(x)superscript𝜑pol𝑥\varphi^{\mathrm{pol}}(x)italic_φ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_pol end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_x ) are 2⁢n2𝑛2\sqrt{n}2 square-root start_ARG italic_n end_ARG and 2222, respectively. Using Assumptions 1(iii), 2, the composite gradient Φ⁢(p)Φ𝑝\Phi(p)roman_Φ ( italic_p ) is thus L′−limit-fromsuperscript𝐿′L^{\prime}-italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT -Lipschitz with respect to p𝑝pitalic_p, where L′=Lp+L2⁢(Lx+2)superscript𝐿′subscript𝐿𝑝superscript𝐿2subscript𝐿𝑥2L^{\prime}=L_{p}+L^{2}(L_{x}+2)italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 2 ). Therefore, the composite cost function φ⁢(p,h⁢(p,d))𝜑𝑝ℎ𝑝𝑑\varphi(p,h(p,d))italic_φ ( italic_p , italic_h ( italic_p , italic_d ) ) is L′−limit-fromsuperscript𝐿′L^{\prime}-italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT -smooth with respect to p𝑝pitalic_p.

We now state the following gradient update in the case where the gradients, sensitivity and opinions are known:

p¯k+1=Π[−1,1]n⁢[pk−η⁢Φ⁢(pk,h⁢(pk,d))],superscript¯𝑝𝑘1subscriptΠsuperscript11𝑛delimited-[]superscript𝑝𝑘𝜂Φsuperscript𝑝𝑘ℎsuperscript𝑝𝑘𝑑\overline{p}^{k+1}=\Pi_{[-1,1]^{n}}[p^{k}-\eta\Phi(p^{k},h(p^{k},d))],over¯ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = roman_Π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ - 1 , 1 ] start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_η roman_Φ ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_h ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_d ) ) ] ,

where Φ⁢(p,h⁢(p,d))Φ𝑝ℎ𝑝𝑑\Phi(p,h(p,d))roman_Φ ( italic_p , italic_h ( italic_p , italic_d ) ) is the composite gradient. The above will serve as a benchmark to investigate the stationarity of our algorithm. We are now in the position to prove the inequalities in (19). To do so, we use Lemma 5.14 with y=p¯k+1𝑦superscript¯𝑝𝑘1y=\overline{p}^{k+1}italic_y = over¯ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, x=pk𝑥superscript𝑝𝑘x=p^{k}italic_x = italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and u=Φ⁢(pk,h⁢(pk,d))𝑢Φsuperscript𝑝𝑘ℎsuperscript𝑝𝑘𝑑u=\Phi(p^{k},h(p^{k},d))italic_u = roman_Φ ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_h ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_d ) ) is the composite gradient. Choosing z=pk𝑧superscript𝑝𝑘z=p^{k}italic_z = italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and taking the expectation on both sides, we obtain:

𝔼⁢[φ⁢(p¯k+1)]≤𝔼⁢[φ⁢(pk)+(L′2−1η)⁢∥p¯k+1−pk∥2].𝔼delimited-[]𝜑superscript¯𝑝𝑘1𝔼delimited-[]𝜑superscript𝑝𝑘superscript𝐿′21𝜂superscriptdelimited-∥∥superscript¯𝑝𝑘1superscript𝑝𝑘2\mathbb{E}\Big{[}\varphi(\overline{p}^{k+1})\Big{]}\leq\mathbb{E}\Big{[}% \varphi(p^{k})+\Big{(}\frac{L^{\prime}}{2}-\frac{1}{\eta}\Big{)}\lVert% \overline{p}^{k+1}-p^{k}\rVert^{2}\Big{]}.blackboard_E [ italic_φ ( over¯ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ] ≤ blackboard_E [ italic_φ ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) + ( divide start_ARG italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_η end_ARG ) ∥ over¯ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] . (L′−12⁢η)∥p¯k+1−pk∥2−12⁢η∥pk+1−p¯k+1∥2].\displaystyle\Big{(}{L^{\prime}}-\frac{1}{2\eta}\Big{)}\lVert\overline{p}^{k+1% }-p^{k}\rVert^{2}-\frac{1}{2\eta}\lVert p^{k+1}-\overline{p}^{k+1}\rVert^{2}% \Big{]}.( italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_η end_ARG ) ∥ over¯ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_η end_ARG ∥ italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] .

We now focus on the term T1subscript𝑇1T_{1}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Using Cauchy-Schwartz relation and the fact that the geometric mean of two non-negative real numbers is always less than its arithmetic mean, we obtain the following: T1≤∥pk+1−p¯k+1∥⁢∥Φ⁢(pk,h⁢(pk,d))−ζk⁢Φ^k∥≤12⁢η⁢∥pk+1−p¯k+1∥2+η2⁢∥Φ⁢(pk,h⁢(pk,d))−ζk⁢Φ^k∥2.subscript𝑇1delimited-∥∥superscript𝑝𝑘1superscript¯𝑝𝑘1delimited-∥∥Φsuperscript𝑝𝑘ℎsuperscript𝑝𝑘𝑑superscript𝜁𝑘superscript^Φ𝑘12𝜂superscriptdelimited-∥∥superscript𝑝𝑘1superscript¯𝑝𝑘12𝜂2superscriptdelimited-∥∥Φsuperscript𝑝𝑘ℎsuperscript𝑝𝑘𝑑superscript𝜁𝑘superscript^Φ𝑘2T_{1}\leq\lVert p^{k+1}-\overline{p}^{k+1}\rVert\ \lVert\Phi(p^{k},h(p^{k},d))% -\zeta^{k}\hat{\Phi}^{k}\rVert\leq\frac{1}{2\eta}\lVert p^{k+1}-\overline{p}^{% k+1}\rVert^{2}+\frac{\eta}{2}\lVert\Phi(p^{k},h(p^{k},d))-\zeta^{k}\hat{\Phi}^% {k}\rVert^{2}.italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ ∥ italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ ∥ roman_Φ ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_h ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_d ) ) - italic_ζ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT over^ start_ARG roman_Φ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ ≤ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_η end_ARG ∥ italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over¯ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + divide start_ARG italic_η end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG ∥ roman_Φ ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_h ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_d ) ) - italic_ζ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT over^ start_ARG roman_Φ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT . Using the above inequality in (32), we obtain:

𝔼[φ(pk+1)]≤𝔼[φ(pk)+(L′2−12⁢η)⁢∥pk+1−pk∥2⏟T2+\displaystyle\mathbb{E}\Big{[}\varphi(p^{k+1})\Big{]}\leq\mathbb{E}\Big{[}% \varphi(p^{k})+\underset{T_{2}}{\underbrace{\Big{(}\frac{L^{\prime}}{2}-\frac{% 1}{2\eta}\Big{)}\lVert p^{k+1}-p^{k}\rVert^{2}}}+blackboard_E [ italic_φ ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ] ≤ blackboard_E [ italic_φ ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) + start_UNDERACCENT italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG under⏟ start_ARG ( divide start_ARG italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_η end_ARG ) ∥ italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG end_ARG + (33)
η2∥Φ(pk,h(pk,d))−ζkΦ^k∥2+(L′−12⁢η)η2∥𝒢(pk)∥2].\displaystyle\frac{\eta}{2}{{\lVert\Phi(p^{k},h(p^{k},d))-\zeta^{k}\hat{\Phi}^% {k}\rVert^{2}}}+\Big{(}{L^{\prime}}-\frac{1}{2\eta}\Big{)}\eta^{2}\lVert% \mathcal{G}(p^{k})\rVert^{2}\Big{]}.divide start_ARG italic_η end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG ∥ roman_Φ ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_h ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_d ) ) - italic_ζ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT over^ start_ARG roman_Φ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + ( italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_η end_ARG ) italic_η start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ caligraphic_G ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] .

In the above inequality, we used the definition of fixed-point residual mapping according to (18).

We now assume that there is a trigger at time instant k𝑘kitalic_k, i.e. ζk=1superscript𝜁𝑘1\zeta^{k}=1italic_ζ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = 1. To obtain a feasible upper-bound on 𝔼⁢[∥𝒢⁢(pk)∥2]𝔼delimited-[]superscriptdelimited-∥∥𝒢superscript𝑝𝑘2\mathbb{E}[\lVert\mathcal{G}(p^{k})\rVert^{2}]blackboard_E [ ∥ caligraphic_G ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ], we need L′−1/2⁢η<0superscript𝐿′12𝜂0L^{\prime}-1/2\eta<0italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 / 2 italic_η < 0. Thus, the step-size is constrained with η∈(0,12⁢L′)𝜂012superscript𝐿′\eta\in(0,\frac{1}{2L^{\prime}})italic_η ∈ ( 0 , divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG ). With this constraint, we have T2≤0subscript𝑇20T_{2}\leq 0italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ 0. This leads to the following:

𝔼⁢[∥𝒢⁢(pk)∥2]𝔼delimited-[]superscriptdelimited-∥∥𝒢superscript𝑝𝑘2\displaystyle\mathbb{E}\Big{[}\lVert\mathcal{G}(p^{k})\rVert^{2}\Big{]}blackboard_E [ ∥ caligraphic_G ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] ≤2η⁢(1−2⁢η⁢L′){𝔼[φ(pk)]−𝔼[φ(pk+1)]+\displaystyle\leq\frac{2}{\eta(1-2\eta L^{\prime})}\Big{\{}\mathbb{E}\Big{[}% \varphi(p^{k})\Big{]}-\mathbb{E}\Big{[}\varphi(p^{k+1})\Big{]}+≤ divide start_ARG 2 end_ARG start_ARG italic_η ( 1 - 2 italic_η italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_ARG { blackboard_E [ italic_φ ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ] - blackboard_E [ italic_φ ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ] +
η2𝔼⁢[∥Φ⁢(pk,h⁢(pk,d))−Φ^k∥2]⏟T3}.\displaystyle\frac{\eta}{2}\underset{T_{3}}{\underbrace{\mathbb{E}\Big{[}% \lVert\Phi(p^{k},h(p^{k},d))-\hat{\Phi}^{k}\rVert^{2}\Big{]}}}\Big{\}}.divide start_ARG italic_η end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG start_UNDERACCENT italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 3 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG under⏟ start_ARG blackboard_E [ ∥ roman_Φ ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_h ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_d ) ) - over^ start_ARG roman_Φ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] end_ARG end_ARG } . (34)

We now analyze the term T3subscript𝑇3T_{3}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 3 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. For the sake of convenience, we drop the arguments of the gradient p,x𝑝𝑥p,xitalic_p , italic_x and time argument k𝑘kitalic_k in the gradient terms. Using the definitions of Φ⁢(pk,h⁢(pk,d)),Φ^kΦsuperscript𝑝𝑘ℎsuperscript𝑝𝑘𝑑superscript^Φ𝑘\Phi(p^{k},h(p^{k},d)),\hat{\Phi}^{k}roman_Φ ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_h ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_d ) ) , over^ start_ARG roman_Φ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, we have:

where Hk=∇ph⁢(pk,d)superscript𝐻𝑘subscript∇𝑝ℎsuperscript𝑝𝑘𝑑H^{k}=\nabla_{p}h(p^{k},d)italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = ∇ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_d ) is the true sensitivity and H^ksuperscript^𝐻𝑘\hat{H}^{k}over^ start_ARG italic_H end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is its estimate at time k𝑘kitalic_k. We now analyze the upper-bound on T3subscript𝑇3T_{3}italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 3 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT:

≤(d)6{\displaystyle\overset{(d)}{\leq}6\Big{\{}start_OVERACCENT ( italic_d ) end_OVERACCENT start_ARG ≤ end_ARG 6 { 4⁢n3/2⁢ϵg⁢(Lp+L2⁢Lx)+σpe2η2+4⁢γ2⁢L2⁢ϵx2+4superscript𝑛32subscriptitalic-ϵ𝑔subscript𝐿𝑝superscript𝐿2subscript𝐿𝑥superscriptsubscript𝜎pe2superscript𝜂2limit-from4superscript𝛾2superscript𝐿2superscriptsubscriptitalic-ϵ𝑥2\displaystyle 4n^{3/2}\epsilon_{g}(L_{p}+L^{2}L_{x})+\frac{\sigma_{\rm pe}^{2}% }{\eta^{2}}+4\gamma^{2}L^{2}\epsilon_{x}^{2}+4 italic_n start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 3 / 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_g end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + divide start_ARG italic_σ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_pe end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_η start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG + 4 italic_γ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT +

≤(e)6{\displaystyle\overset{(e)}{\leq}6\Big{\{}start_OVERACCENT ( italic_e ) end_OVERACCENT start_ARG ≤ end_ARG 6 { 4⁢n3/2⁢ϵg⁢(Lp+L2⁢Lx)+σpe2η2+4⁢γ2⁢L2⁢ϵx2+4superscript𝑛32subscriptitalic-ϵ𝑔subscript𝐿𝑝superscript𝐿2subscript𝐿𝑥superscriptsubscript𝜎pe2superscript𝜂2limit-from4superscript𝛾2superscript𝐿2superscriptsubscriptitalic-ϵ𝑥2\displaystyle 4n^{3/2}\epsilon_{g}(L_{p}+L^{2}L_{x})+\frac{\sigma_{\rm pe}^{2}% }{\eta^{2}}+4\gamma^{2}L^{2}\epsilon_{x}^{2}+4 italic_n start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 3 / 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_g end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + divide start_ARG italic_σ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_pe end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_η start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG + 4 italic_γ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT +

≤(f)6{\displaystyle\overset{(f)}{\leq}6\Big{\{}start_OVERACCENT ( italic_f ) end_OVERACCENT start_ARG ≤ end_ARG 6 { 4⁢n3/2⁢ϵg⁢(Lp+L2⁢Lx)+σpe2η2+4⁢γ2⁢L2⁢ϵx2+4superscript𝑛32subscriptitalic-ϵ𝑔subscript𝐿𝑝superscript𝐿2subscript𝐿𝑥superscriptsubscript𝜎pe2superscript𝜂2limit-from4superscript𝛾2superscript𝐿2superscriptsubscriptitalic-ϵ𝑥2\displaystyle 4n^{3/2}\epsilon_{g}(L_{p}+L^{2}L_{x})+\frac{\sigma_{\rm pe}^{2}% }{\eta^{2}}+4\gamma^{2}L^{2}\epsilon_{x}^{2}+4 italic_n start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 3 / 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_g end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + divide start_ARG italic_σ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_pe end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_η start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG + 4 italic_γ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT +

To obtain (a)𝑎(a)( italic_a ), we added and subtracted (Hk)⊤⁢∇xφ^ctrsuperscriptsuperscript𝐻𝑘topsubscript∇𝑥superscript^𝜑ctr(H^{k})^{\top}\nabla_{x}\hat{\varphi}^{\rm ctr}( italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⊤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∇ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT over^ start_ARG italic_φ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_ctr end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and γ⁢(Hk)⊤⁢∇xφpol⁢(x^k+1)𝛾superscriptsuperscript𝐻𝑘topsubscript∇𝑥superscript𝜑polsuperscript^𝑥𝑘1\gamma(H^{k})^{\top}\nabla_{x}\varphi^{\rm pol}(\hat{x}^{k+1})italic_γ ( italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ⊤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∇ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_φ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_pol end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) inside the norm in (35). We then used the fact that 𝔼⁢[∥∑j=1mrj∥2]≤m⁢∑j=1m𝔼⁢[∥rj∥2]𝔼delimited-[]superscriptdelimited-∥∥superscriptsubscript𝑗1𝑚subscript𝑟𝑗2𝑚superscriptsubscript𝑗1𝑚𝔼delimited-[]superscriptdelimited-∥∥subscript𝑟𝑗2\mathbb{E}\Big{[}\lVert\sum_{j=1}^{m}r_{j}\rVert^{2}\Big{]}\leq m\sum_{j=1}^{m% }\mathbb{E}\Big{[}\lVert r_{j}\rVert^{2}\Big{]}blackboard_E [ ∥ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] ≤ italic_m ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT blackboard_E [ ∥ italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ]. We also make use of the fact that 𝔼⁢[∥wpek∥2]=σpe2𝔼delimited-[]superscriptdelimited-∥∥superscriptsubscript𝑤pe𝑘2superscriptsubscript𝜎pe2\mathbb{E}[\lVert w_{\rm pe}^{k}\rVert^{2}]=\sigma_{\rm pe}^{2}blackboard_E [ ∥ italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_pe end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] = italic_σ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_pe end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. In (b)𝑏(b)( italic_b ), we made use of Lemma 3.6 for the gradient estimate accuracy on φctrsuperscript𝜑ctr\varphi^{\rm ctr}italic_φ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_ctr end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and Assumption 1(iii) for Lipschitz condition on h⁢(p,d)ℎ𝑝𝑑h(p,d)italic_h ( italic_p , italic_d ) to arrive at the term 4⁢n3/2⁢ϵg⁢(Lp+L2⁢Lx)4superscript𝑛32subscriptitalic-ϵ𝑔subscript𝐿𝑝superscript𝐿2subscript𝐿𝑥4n^{3/2}\epsilon_{g}(L_{p}+L^{2}L_{x})4 italic_n start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 3 / 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_g end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ). In (c)𝑐(c)( italic_c ), we made use of Remark 5.16 for the smoothness condition on φpolsuperscript𝜑pol\varphi^{\rm pol}italic_φ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_pol end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and Assumption 1(iii) for Lipschitz condition on h⁢(p,d)ℎ𝑝𝑑h(p,d)italic_h ( italic_p , italic_d ) to arrive at the term 4⁢L2⁢∥x−x^∥24superscript𝐿2superscriptdelimited-∥∥𝑥^𝑥24L^{2}\lVert x-\hat{x}\rVert^{2}4 italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ italic_x - over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. In (d)𝑑(d)( italic_d ), we made use of the fact that the norm of the steady-state opinion estimation error is upper-bounded by ϵxsubscriptitalic-ϵ𝑥\epsilon_{x}italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. In (e)𝑒(e)( italic_e ), we made use of Remark 5.16 for the Lipschitz condition on φpolsuperscript𝜑pol\varphi^{\rm pol}italic_φ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_pol end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, thus arriving at the term 4⁢n4𝑛4n4 italic_n. We also add and subtract the term ∇xφctrsubscript∇𝑥superscript𝜑ctr\nabla_{x}{\varphi}^{\rm ctr}∇ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_φ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_ctr end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. Further, we use inequality ∥Hk−H^k∥≤∥Hk−H^k∥F=∥ek∥delimited-∥∥superscript𝐻𝑘superscript^𝐻𝑘subscriptdelimited-∥∥superscript𝐻𝑘superscript^𝐻𝑘𝐹delimited-∥∥superscript𝑒𝑘\lVert H^{k}-\hat{H}^{k}\rVert\leq\lVert H^{k}-\hat{H}^{k}\rVert_{F}=\lVert e^% {k}\rVert∥ italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over^ start_ARG italic_H end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ ≤ ∥ italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over^ start_ARG italic_H end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_F end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ∥ italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥, where ∥⋅∥Fsubscriptdelimited-∥∥⋅𝐹\lVert\cdot\rVert_{F}∥ ⋅ ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_F end_POSTSUBSCRIPT refers to the Frobenius norm and eksuperscript𝑒𝑘e^{k}italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is the sensitivity estimation error. In (f)𝑓(f)( italic_f ), we made use of the fact that ∥a+b∥2≤2⁢(∥a∥2+∥b∥2)superscriptdelimited-∥∥𝑎𝑏22superscriptdelimited-∥∥𝑎2superscriptdelimited-∥∥𝑏2\lVert a+b\rVert^{2}\leq 2(\lVert a\rVert^{2}+\lVert b\rVert^{2})∥ italic_a + italic_b ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ≤ 2 ( ∥ italic_a ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + ∥ italic_b ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ). We then use Assumption 2 to state that ∥∇xφctr∥≤Mxdelimited-∥∥subscript∇𝑥superscript𝜑ctrsubscript𝑀𝑥\lVert\nabla_{x}\varphi^{\rm ctr}\rVert\leq M_{x}∥ ∇ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_φ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_ctr end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ ≤ italic_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and Lemma 3.6 to state the upper-bound on ∥∇xφctr−∇xφ^ctr∥delimited-∥∥subscript∇𝑥superscript𝜑ctrsubscript∇𝑥superscript^𝜑ctr\lVert\nabla_{x}\varphi^{\rm ctr}-\nabla_{x}\hat{\varphi}^{\rm ctr}\rVert∥ ∇ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_φ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_ctr end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - ∇ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT over^ start_ARG italic_φ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_ctr end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥.

We now use the inequality (36) in (34) and add the inequalities over the trigger time instances up to k𝑘kitalic_k, leading to telescopic cancellation. Thus, we have:

∑l∈𝒯l≤k𝔼[∥𝒢(pl)∥2\displaystyle\sum_{\underset{l\leq k}{l\in\mathcal{T}}}\mathbb{E}[\lVert% \mathcal{G}(p^{l})\rVert^{2}∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_UNDERACCENT italic_l ≤ italic_k end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG italic_l ∈ caligraphic_T end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_E [ ∥ caligraphic_G ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ]≤2η⁢(1−2⁢η⁢L′){𝔼[φ(p0)]−𝔼[φ(pk+1)]}+\displaystyle]\leq\frac{2}{\eta(1-2\eta L^{\prime})}\Big{\{}\mathbb{E}\Big{[}% \varphi(p^{0})\Big{]}-\mathbb{E}\Big{[}\varphi(p^{k+1})\Big{]}\Big{\}}+] ≤ divide start_ARG 2 end_ARG start_ARG italic_η ( 1 - 2 italic_η italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_ARG { blackboard_E [ italic_φ ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ] - blackboard_E [ italic_φ ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k + 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ] } +
6⁢|𝒯|1−2⁢η⁢L′⁢{4⁢n3/2⁢ϵg⁢(Lp+L2⁢Lx)+σpe2η2+4⁢γ2⁢L2⁢ϵx2}+limit-from6𝒯12𝜂superscript𝐿′4superscript𝑛32subscriptitalic-ϵ𝑔subscript𝐿𝑝superscript𝐿2subscript𝐿𝑥superscriptsubscript𝜎pe2superscript𝜂24superscript𝛾2superscript𝐿2superscriptsubscriptitalic-ϵ𝑥2\displaystyle\frac{6|\mathcal{T}|}{1-2\eta L^{\prime}}\Big{\{}4n^{3/2}\epsilon% _{g}(L_{p}+L^{2}L_{x})+\frac{\sigma_{\rm pe}^{2}}{\eta^{2}}+4\gamma^{2}L^{2}% \epsilon_{x}^{2}\Big{\}}+divide start_ARG 6 | caligraphic_T | end_ARG start_ARG 1 - 2 italic_η italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG { 4 italic_n start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 3 / 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_g end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + divide start_ARG italic_σ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_pe end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_η start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG + 4 italic_γ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT } +
12⁢[2⁢n⁢γ2+(Mx2+4⁢n3/2⁢ϵg⁢Lx)]1−2⁢η⁢L′⁢∑l∈𝒯l≤k𝔼⁢[∥el∥2].12delimited-[]2𝑛superscript𝛾2superscriptsubscript𝑀𝑥24superscript𝑛32subscriptitalic-ϵ𝑔subscript𝐿𝑥12𝜂superscript𝐿′subscript𝑙𝑘𝑙𝒯𝔼delimited-[]superscriptdelimited-∥∥superscript𝑒𝑙2\displaystyle\frac{12\big{[}2n\gamma^{2}+(M_{x}^{2}+4n^{3/2}\epsilon_{g}L_{x})% \big{]}}{1-2\eta L^{\prime}}\sum_{\underset{l\leq k}{l\in\mathcal{T}}}\mathbb{% E}\Big{[}\lVert e^{l}\rVert^{2}\Big{]}.divide start_ARG 12 [ 2 italic_n italic_γ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + ( italic_M start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + 4 italic_n start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 3 / 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_g end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ] end_ARG start_ARG 1 - 2 italic_η italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_UNDERACCENT italic_l ≤ italic_k end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG italic_l ∈ caligraphic_T end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_E [ ∥ italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] .

Since the positions do not change between two consecutive trigger time instances, it is sufficient to investigate convergence guarantees at the trigger time instances.

Using Theorem 3.8 for the upper-bound on 𝔼⁢[∥ek∥2]𝔼delimited-[]superscriptdelimited-∥∥superscript𝑒𝑘2\mathbb{E}[\lVert e^{k}\rVert^{2}]blackboard_E [ ∥ italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ], the summation of this term over the trigger instances leads to the following:

∑l∈𝒯l≤k𝔼⁢[∥el∥2]≤subscript𝑙𝑘𝑙𝒯𝔼delimited-[]superscriptdelimited-∥∥superscript𝑒𝑙2absent\displaystyle\sum_{\underset{l\leq k}{l\in\mathcal{T}}}\mathbb{E}\Big{[}\lVert e% ^{l}\rVert^{2}\Big{]}\leq∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_UNDERACCENT italic_l ≤ italic_k end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG italic_l ∈ caligraphic_T end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_E [ ∥ italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] ≤ |𝒯|⁢Cf+𝔼⁢[∥e0∥2]⁢∑l∈𝒯l≤k(c1⁢ξc2⁢T)2⁢|𝒯|𝒯subscript𝐶𝑓𝔼delimited-[]superscriptdelimited-∥∥superscript𝑒02subscript𝑙𝑘𝑙𝒯superscriptsubscript𝑐1superscript𝜉subscript𝑐2𝑇2𝒯\displaystyle|\mathcal{T}|C_{f}+\mathbb{E}\Big{[}\lVert e^{0}\rVert^{2}\Big{]}% \sum_{\underset{l\leq k}{l\in\mathcal{T}}}(c_{1}\xi^{c_{2}T})^{2|\mathcal{T}|}| caligraphic_T | italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + blackboard_E [ ∥ italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_UNDERACCENT italic_l ≤ italic_k end_UNDERACCENT start_ARG italic_l ∈ caligraphic_T end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ξ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 | caligraphic_T | end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT (37)
|𝒯|⁢Cf+𝔼⁢[∥e0∥2]⁢(1−(c1⁢ξc2⁢T)2⁢|𝒯|1−(c1⁢ξc2⁢T)2).𝒯subscript𝐶𝑓𝔼delimited-[]superscriptdelimited-∥∥superscript𝑒021superscriptsubscript𝑐1superscript𝜉subscript𝑐2𝑇2𝒯1superscriptsubscript𝑐1superscript𝜉subscript𝑐2𝑇2\displaystyle|\mathcal{T}|C_{f}+\mathbb{E}\Big{[}\lVert e^{0}\rVert^{2}\Big{]}% \Big{(}\frac{1-(c_{1}\xi^{c_{2}T})^{2|\mathcal{T}|}}{1-(c_{1}\xi^{c_{2}T})^{2}% }\Big{)}.| caligraphic_T | italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + blackboard_E [ ∥ italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] ( divide start_ARG 1 - ( italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ξ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 | caligraphic_T | end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 1 - ( italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ξ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG ) .

We start the algorithm with p0=0nsuperscript𝑝0subscript0𝑛p^{0}=0_{n}italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = 0 start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, thus 𝔼⁢[φ⁢(p0)]=φ⁢(0)𝔼delimited-[]𝜑superscript𝑝0𝜑0\mathbb{E}\Big{[}\varphi(p^{0})\Big{]}=\varphi(0)blackboard_E [ italic_φ ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ] = italic_φ ( 0 ). Further, ∃φ∗≤𝔼⁢[φ⁢(pk)],∀k∈ℕ0formulae-sequencesuperscript𝜑𝔼delimited-[]𝜑superscript𝑝𝑘for-all𝑘subscriptℕ0\exists\ \varphi^{*}\leq\mathbb{E}\Big{[}\varphi(p^{k})\Big{]},\forall k\in% \mathbb{N}_{0}∃ italic_φ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ≤ blackboard_E [ italic_φ ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ] , ∀ italic_k ∈ blackboard_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, i.e. φ∗superscript𝜑\varphi^{*}italic_φ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is a local optimal value. Thus, with the above formulations and (37), we obtain (19).

{tac}{IEEEbiography}

[]Sanjay Chandrasekaran recieved his B. Tech. degree in Instrumentation and Control and his MSc. degree in Information Technology and Electrical Engineering from the National Institute of Technology, Tiruchirappalli, India and ETH Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland in 2021 and 2023, respectively. His research interests lie in optimization-based control, learning-based control and network control systems.

{IEEEbiography}

[]Giulia De Pasquale (Member, IEEE) received the B.Sc. degree in Information Engineering, the M.Sc. degree in Control engineering and Ph.D. degree in Automatic Control in 2017, 2019, 2023, respectively, from the University of Padova, Padua, Italy. She is currently a post-doctoral researcher at the Automatic Control Laboratory, ETH Zürich, Zurich, Switzerland. Her current research interests include modeling, analysis, and control of networked socio-technical systems.

{IEEEbiography}

[]Giuseppe Belgioioso (Member, IEEE) is an Assistant Professor at the Division of Decision and Control Systems at KTH Royal Institute of Technology, Sweden. He received the Bachelor’s degree in Information Engineering in 2012 and the Master’s degree (cum laude) in Control Systems in 2015, both at the University of Padova, Italy. In 2020, he obtained the Ph.D. degree in Automatic Control at Eindhoven University of Technology (TU/e), The Netherlands. From 2021 to 2024, he was first a Postdoctoral researcher and then Senior Scientist at the Automatic Control Laboratory at ETH Zürich, Switzerland. His research lies at the intersection of optimization, game theory, and automatic control with applications in complex systems, such as electrical power grids and traffic networks.

{IEEEbiography}

[]Florian Dörfler (Senior Member, IEEE) received the Diploma in engineering cybernetics from the University of Stuttgart, Stuttgart, Germany, in 2008 and the Ph.D. degree in mechanical engineering from the University of California at Santa Barbara, CA, USA, in 2013. He is currently a Full Professor with the Automatic Control Laboratory, ETH Zürich, Zürich, Switzerland. His research interests include control, optimization, and system theory with applications in network systems, in particular electric power grids.

Generated on Thu Sep 26 14:17:26 2024 by LaTeXML
